title: How to Make a Swedish Tea Ring

steps.headline: Add the sugar, salt and yeast to a mixing bowl.
Add the egg and shortening to the yeast mixture.
Add 3 1/2 cups flour and mix.
Slowly add the milk and mix until a soft dough forms.
steps.description: You may need to add more milk or flour until you get the right dough consistency. The dough should be form into a soft ball and start to look sticky.

steps.headline: Knead the dough until smooth and satiny.
Let rise until double.
Turn out dough and roll out into a 9 x 18-inch oblong.
Spread the soft butter over the dough.
Add the sugar, cinnamon and raisins to a small mixing bowl.
Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar raisin mixture over the buttered dough.
Roll up dough starting from the wide side.
Pinch dough edges together.
steps.description: Place seam-side down on a large baking pan.

steps.headline: Form the dough into a circle and join the edges together.
steps.description: Pinch the ends together to seal.

steps.headline: Cut the dough 2/3 of the way through in 1-inch sections.
steps.description: Use a pair of scissors to cut the dough.

steps.headline: Let dough rise until double.
Preheat oven to 375 °F (191 °C).
Place Swedish Tea Ring dough into the oven.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden.
Add the powdered sugar to a small mixing bowl.
Add enough warm water, milk or cream to get the right consistency.
steps.description: The icing should be somewhat thick but not like frosting for a dessert cake.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla to the icing.
Drizzle the icing with a fork over the warm coffee cake.

text: Yeast Dough Add the sugar, salt and yeast to a mixing bowl.  Add the egg and shortening to the yeast mixture.  Add 3 1/2 cups flour and mix.  Slowly add the milk and mix until a soft dough forms. You may need to add more milk or flour until you get the right dough consistency. The dough should be form into a soft ball and start to look sticky. Knead the dough until smooth and satiny.  Let rise until double.  Turn out dough and roll out into a 9 x 18-inch oblong.  Filling Spread the soft butter over the dough.  Add the sugar, cinnamon and raisins to a small mixing bowl. Mix to combine. Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar raisin mixture over the buttered dough.  Roll up dough starting from the wide side.  Pinch dough edges together. Place seam-side down on a large baking pan. Form the dough into a circle and join the edges together. Pinch the ends together to seal. Cut the dough 2/3 of the way through in 1-inch sections. Use a pair of scissors to cut the dough. Let dough rise until double.  Preheat oven to 375 °F (191 °C).  Place Swedish Tea Ring dough into the oven.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden.  Powdered Sugar Icing Add the powdered sugar to a small mixing bowl.  Add enough warm water, milk or cream to get the right consistency. The icing should be somewhat thick but not like frosting for a dessert cake. Add the vanilla to the icing. Mix well. Drizzle the icing with a fork over the warm coffee cake.
sentences: Yeast Dough Add the sugar, salt and yeast to a mixing bowl.
Add the egg and shortening to the yeast mixture.
Add 3 1/2 cups flour and mix.
Slowly add the milk and mix until a soft dough forms.
You may need to add more milk or flour until you get the right dough consistency.
The dough should be form into a soft ball and start to look sticky.
Knead the dough until smooth and satiny.
Let rise until double.
Turn out dough and roll out into a 9 x 18-inch oblong.
Filling Spread the soft butter over the dough.
Add the sugar, cinnamon and raisins to a small mixing bowl.
Mix to combine.
Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar raisin mixture over the buttered dough.
Roll up dough starting from the wide side.
Pinch dough edges together.
Place seam-side down on a large baking pan.
Form the dough into a circle and join the edges together.
Pinch the ends together to seal.
Cut the dough 2/3 of the way through in 1-inch sections.
Use a pair of scissors to cut the dough.
Let dough rise until double.
Preheat oven to 375 °F (191 °C).
Place Swedish Tea Ring dough into the oven.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden.
Powdered Sugar Icing Add the powdered sugar to a small mixing bowl.
Add enough warm water, milk or cream to get the right consistency.
The icing should be somewhat thick but not like frosting for a dessert cake.
Add the vanilla to the icing.
Mix well.
Drizzle the icing with a fork over the warm coffee cake.
